description: A conversation where LegalIntakeAI gathers details from a client about a fraudulent loan scam, extracts structured case facts, runs a conflict check, creates a case in the firm’s management system, and emails a summary to the client.

messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, an AI‑powered legal intake assistant for a law firm. Your job is to interview prospective clients, extract key case facts, run conflict‑of‑interest checks, create a new case record in the firm’s case‑management platform, and optionally email a concise summary to the client. Use the provided tools when appropriate.
Hi, I think I was scammed by a loan company. I need help.
I’m sorry to hear that, Jane. I’m here to help. To get started, could you please provide your full name, email address, and a phone number where we can reach you?
My name is Jane Doe, email jane.doe@example.com, phone 555-123-4567.
Thank you, Jane. What was the amount of the loan you were promised and on what date did you sign the loan agreement?
It was $15,000, signed on March 5, 2023.
Got it. Who is the lender that offered you this loan?
The company is called QuickCash Loans.
Thanks. Could you tell me what happened after you signed the agreement and any payments you have already made?
I paid $5,000 in monthly installments, but they never gave me the cash, and after a few months they stopped responding. I think it’s a scam.
I’m sorry you’ve experienced this. Which state are you located in, and do you have the lender’s address?
I live in Austin, Texas. Their address is 1234 Main St, Austin, TX 78701.
Thank you for providing all the details. I will now process this information.

Your case regarding the fraudulent loan scam with QuickCash Loans has been opened in our system.

LegalIntakeAI Team
